reference.title: Types of Smith Corona Portable Manual Typewriter Cases
reference.shortdesc: Typewriter cases are protective, portable storage containers used to store and transport typewriters when not in use. Smith Corona Portable Typewriters may be found with various different case types.

section.title: Types of Smith Corona Portable Manual Typewriter Cases

dlentry.dd: Rigid cases containing a metal or wood base, wrapped with tweed-style or vinyl coverings. Produced in the late 1940's to early 1950's.
Rigid cases containing a wooden base and bracing, wrapped with leather. Produced in the 1930's and 1940's.

A large, highly durable, hard shell, molded case. Marketed as a premium portable typewriter case, doubling as a suitcase. Most commonly found case with vintage Smith Corona's. Produced from the 1950's to the late 1990's.
Smooth, lightweight cases, molded using fiberglass, injection ABS, or polystyrene plastic. They are often equipped with aluminum locks and hinges. Produced from the 1960's to the late 1990's.
Covers made from vinyl or fabric sheeting that rests on top of a typewriter, protecting the typewriter mechanisms from dust and debris.
